description.narrative: The development objective of the Local Government Strengthening Project for El Salvador is to improve the administrative, financial and technical processes, systems and capacity of local governments to deliver basic services, as prioritized by local communities, in the medium and long-term. In the ratification of the Loan by the National Legislative Assembly of El Salvador by Legislative Decree 455, dated August 26, 2010, the assembly mandated giving municipalities more direct execution of project technical assistance grants related to increasing overall municipal administrative capacity and municipal disaster risk management. Responding to this requirement requires four changes in the project and is the basis for this restructuring. Two are in the implementation of activities four and five in Part B institutional strengthening. One is the addition of a new disbursement category and one is related to the designated account ceiling amount for Part A managed by the ministry of finance. Given that an additional US$15,185,400 will be transferred directly from the ministry of finance to the municipalities, an increase in the designated account ceiling for Part A of the project is needed from US$32.0 million to US$39.5 million.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1, D | Description :1. The Borrower, through SAE, shall ensure, and cause theMunicipalities, FISDL and ISDEM to ensure, that the Project activities under their responsibility are carried out in accordancewith the | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 2, A.1 | Description :The Borrower, through SAE, shall cause ISDEM to monitor and evaluatethe progress of the Project and prepare and furnish to the Bank Project Reports in accordance with the provisions of Section 5 |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 2, B.2 | Description :2. Without limitation on the provisions of Part A of this Section, theBorrower, through SAE, shall cause FISDL and ISDEM, to prepare, as part of the Project Report, interim unaudited financial r |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 5, A.1 | Description :Pursuant to terms of reference previously agreed with the Bank,including, inter alia, the scope of the audits to be conducted and furnished to the Bank, and as further specified in the Project |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 | Description :The Additional Conditions of Effectiveness consists of the following, namely thatthe Implementation Agreement has been executed onbehalf of the Borrower, through SAE, ISDEM, and FISDL. | Due Date :19-Oct-2010

Finance Agreement :Section 5.02 | Description :As part of the evidence to be furnished pursuant to Section 5.01 of this Agreement,there shall be furnished to the Bank an opinionor opinions satisfactory to the Bank of counsel acceptable to | Due Date :19-Oct-2010

title.narrative: Percentage of local governments that progress by at least one capacity category on areas for which they received TA.
All locally defined and prioritized Municipal Subproject investments of 262 Municipalities are implemented in accordance with fiduciary and safeguards policies as well as national standards
Percentage of requests from local governments for techncial assistance recieved by ISDEM, dealt with in a timely and satisfactory manner.

actual.value: Yes, proposal prepared (for three sectors and two cross cutting themes)

title.narrative: No. of local governments that have completed and implemented a public finances consolidation plan
No. of local governments that have completed and implemented a disaster risk management plan
No. of local govt employees and officials trained through ISDEM's vocational training and the municipal strengthening program.
No. of local governments that have completed and implemented participatory strategic plans
Percentage of Citizen Control Committees that supervise construction and agree to monitor the functioning of project financed investments
Percentage of investments satisfactorily completed according to contractual documents (including tech specs)
No. of local governments that have implemented and are using the financial management system (SAFIM) developed by Ministry of Finance
Percentage of local governments have plan for maintenance of sub-projects
Percentage of investments built/rehabilitated that are effectively used at end of project
ISDEM has set up and maintains a database to monitor its technical assistance to local governments

actual.value: No, database established but rollout still to take place by Dec 9

title.narrative: A strategy and new curriculum for ISDEM's Training Center has been produced and implemented

actual.value: Yes, strategy and curriculum completed and implemented
